III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A resides currently at Vista Maria. Youth A is pregnant and
the father is a staff at Vista Maria.
1

Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed on 1/31/25 via telephone.
Complainant did not add any additional information to the
complaint.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 2/4/25. Staff
3 reported that the facility is aware of the rumor and have since
addressed it by taking the youth for pregnancy tests which came
back negative. Staff 3 denied knowledge of who the alleged father
was at the time of the interview.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face on 2/4/25. Initially, Youth A
refused to speak with the consultant and stated that she did not
want to talk. Youth A then agreed to come back into the room and
speak with the consultant. Youth A reported that she is not
pregnant and that she took two tests to confirm. Youth A reported
that she never thought that she was pregnant. Youth A denied
having any inappropriate or sexual relationship with any staff at
the facility. Youth A reported that someone else said that I looked
like I could be pregnant and started a rumor. Youth A reported that
she did not know who started it or who she heard say it but that
she was then talked to by staff and taken for pregnancy tests.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 2/4/25. Staff
1 reported that she was on the wing when she heard a
conversation going on between Youth B and Youth C that one of
them was angry with the other for starting a rumor that Youth A
was pregnant. Staff 1 could not recall which youth was accusing
whom of starting the rumor. Staff 1 reported she notified the
supervisor of the rumor at which time she was told to complete a
complaint to centralized intake and have Youth A taken for
pregnancy tests. Staff 1 reported Youth A tested negative. Staff 1
denied any knowledge or witnessing any male staff having
inappropriate relationships with any youth or being inappropriate
with any youth.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 2/4/25.
Youth B reported that she knew about the rumor that a youth may
be pregnant and identified the youth to be Youth A. Youth B
reported that it was the rumor that Staff 2 is the father. Youth B
reported that Youth C started the rumor and denied knowing why.
Youth B denied knowledge or witnessing Staff 2 be inappropriate
with Youth A or any other youth.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 2/4/25.
Youth C reported that she was aware of a rumor that Youth A is
pregnant and did not know about who the father was. Youth C
denied starting the rumor. Youth C denied knowledge of who may
2

have started a rumor regarding this. Youth C reported that she
knew it was not true that Youth A is pregnant. Youth C denied
witnessing or knowledge of any staff having inappropriate contact
with any youth including Youth A.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 2/4/25. Staff
2 reported that he was made aware of the rumor regarding Youth
A being pregnant and being the father. Staff 2 denied the
allegation and reported that he was not aware of where the rumor
came from or why. Staff 2 denied any inappropriate behavior
including any sexual contact with any youth at the facility including
Youth A. Staff 2 denied being alone at any time with Youth A.
Documentation reviewed:
• Clinic test results from Dr. Tiffney Widner dated 1/30/2025
showing a negative pregnancy test result.
• Henry Ford Health after visit summary dated 1/31/2025
showing a negative pregnancy test result.
• Human Resources File regarding Staff 2. Record shows no
concerns regarding Staff 2’s behavior with youth at the
facility.
Analysis No violation is found regarding the allegation. It was consistently
denied by the alleged youth victim, youth witnesses, and staff
interviewed that the youth is pregnant. There were two pregnancy
tests completed reflecting a negative test result. There are no
concerns regarding Staff 2 having any sexual contact with Youth A
or any other youth at the facility.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
